author: RomanP
post_text: June 14, 2013 at 8:20 AM#1The defaultmixcolorreadout must be CMY !!!!Select any Fixture and start the macrotype the lee-number in the box ... thats allits a faster way to set the color.type for Lee 068 only 68 ( without the first zero )All values for the color are from GM2 V 3.0.0.2 SwatchBook   <<<<< UPDATEThe defaultmixcolorreadout must be CMY !!!!if anybody need the others colors ( rosco ... ) i can also create a macro for thisThe macros are now exported with GM2 V3.1.1.1Sorry for my bad englishFilessel. at LEE Filter.xml53.98 kB – 165 Downloadssel. at ROSCO Filter.xml49.77 kB – 190 Downloads

posts.author: Duplicate MarkvanderMeulen
posts.post_text: October 21, 2013 at 12:26 AM#5Hi Roman in addition to your macro you could add: Assign Userprofile "Username" /defaultcolormode=CMYto force the colormode to CMY

posts.author: Duplicate Jason Gardash
posts.post_text: January 27, 2014 at 6:30 PM#6Hey Mark,I tried adding this to my color macro but I get and error #14 Object does not exist.I'm using 2.9.0.7  Build date Nov 8 2013any ideas?Jason

posts.author: Duplicate MarkvanderMeulen
posts.post_text: January 28, 2014 at 9:52 AM#7yes this was a command that worked in 2.8.x. now the default colormode has been renamed to default mixcolor, i have not yet figured out what the new keyword would look like but when i know it i will post it here

posts.author: Duplicate MarkvanderMeulen
posts.post_text: January 28, 2014 at 10:10 AM#8Hi JasonThe macro line should be :Assign UserProfile "MyUsername" /defaultmixcolorreadout=CMY

posts.author: Duplicate Jason Gardash
posts.post_text: January 28, 2014 at 3:46 PM#9thanks for the reply,I was messing with different mixcolor wording yesterday.. readout is one I would never had though of.Jason.

posts.author: markandrewpowell
posts.post_text: July 24, 2015 at 11:11 PM#11Hello, I cant seem to get this macro to work. I select fixtures, run the macro and type in the number but the color output is nowhere near correct. Any clues to what Im doing wrong?For instance, Lee 106 gives RGB values of R: 1% G: 19% B: 4%Many thanks for any help or advice.

posts.author: Duplicate MarkvanderMeulen
posts.post_text: July 25, 2015 at 1:20 PM#12This looks like the default colormix readout is set to the wrong setting, set the readout to CMY by this syntax: assign userprofile "yourusername"/defaultmixcolorreadout=cmy

posts.author: RomanP
posts.post_text: July 26, 2015 at 7:06 PM#13You are right the defaultmixcolorreadout must be cmyI had it not integrated, because i have a another macro thattoogle the defaultmixcolorreadout mode from cmy <> rgbSorry for my bad english

posts.author: markandrewpowell
posts.post_text: July 27, 2015 at 9:26 PM#14Thanks for the replies gents. Set the default color mix to CMY but still the same result. I'm sure I'm doing something wrong here!Any other help greatly appreciated.

posts.author: RomanP
